item.title: Converting ER Diagrams to a [[Relational Model]]
item.description: Even though [[/notes/ER Diagrams|ER Diagrams]] contain more semantic information, they are harder to turn into actual databases because some of the constraints are impossible to represent.

item.title: ER Diagram Attributes
item.description: Attributes of an [[/notes/Entity|Entity]] can be represented in [[/notes/ER Diagrams|ER Diagrams]] using an ellipse connecting to an attribute. However, there other ways to do that as well.

item.title: ER Diagrams
item.description: ER diagrams are used to model [[/notes/Entity|Entity]]s, their attributes and the relations between those entities. In ER diagramming, there are constructs and symbols relating to those constructs.

item.title: Total Participation in ER Diagrams
item.description: When drawing [[/notes/ER Diagrams|ER Diagrams]], you need to draw relationships between [[/notes/Entity|Entity]]s, for which you use lines. However, there are cases where a single line is not enough, cases where you need to enforce that line.

item.title: Weak Entity and Identifying Relationship in ER Diagrams
item.description: A [[/notes/Weak Entity|Weak Entity]] in [[/notes/ER Diagrams|ER Diagrams]] is an entity type that depends on another entity for its existence and cannot exist without it.
